usefulItems: ceramic or glass bowl, bowl, nut bag or fine mesh sieve, plastic wrap, 4 serving bowls, refrigerator
title: Tahini cream with blackberries (Raymond Capaldi)

ingredients.content: 200 g fresh blackberries, to serve (see Tips)
edible flowers (e.g.unsprayed pansies and orange blossoms) or herbs (e.g. baby mint leaves), to serve (see Tips)

preparations.content: Place a ceramic or glass bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh cold water into it. Add gelatine leaves to bowl with water. Leave to soak until swelled and softened (approx. 7-10 minutes).
Place cream and honey into mixing bowl and heat <b>4 min/60°C/speed 2<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place egg yolks and tahini into mixing bowl and whip <b>1 min/speed 4<b>. Transfer into a separate bowl and set aside.
Place reserved cream mixture back into mixing bowl and mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>, slowly adding tahini mixture through hole in mixing bowl lid, then cook <b>4 min/80°C/speed 2<b>.
Squeeze gelatine leaves to remove excess water, then add leaves to mixing bowl and mix <b>4 min/speed 3<b>. Discard soaking water. <b>Remove butterfly whisk<b>.
Pass tahini cream mixture through a fine mesh sieve or nut milk bag into a bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and place into refrigerator to set for a minimum of 4 hours. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place tahini cream into mixing bowl and blend <b>20 sec/speed 9<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and repeat blending <b>20 sec/speed 9<b> or until smooth.
Divide tahini cream between 4 serving bowls and top with blackberries, edible flowers and herbs just before serving.

hintsAndTricks: If fresh blackberries are unavailable, use 200 g frozen blackberries, thawed and drained on paper towel to remove excess moisture.
Edible flowers are a wonderful addition to both sweet and savoury dishes. It is best to grow your own or purchase from a reputable organic supplier so you can avoid herbicides or pesticides.
Reserve egg whites and use in omelettes, pavlova or mousses.
